Google's post-IPO stock performance has been very good as well, with shares hitting $700 for the first time on [[October 31]], [[2007]]<ref> [[Daily Telegraph]] Issue 47,409 Business Section Page B5 date,7th November, 2007</ref> , due to strong sales and earnings in the advertising market, as well as the release of new features like the [[Google Desktop|desktop search function]] and personalized home page.<ref name="bowlingforgoogle">La Monica, Paul R. "[http://money.cnn.com/2005/05/25/technology/techinvestor/lamonica/index.htm Bowling for Google]." ''[[CNN]].'' [[May 25]], [[2005]]. Retrieved on [[February 28]] [[2007]].</ref> The surge in stock price is fueled primarily by individual investors, as opposed to large institutional investors and [[mutual fund]]s.<ref name="bowlingforgoogle"/>
